text:
My first experience as a pharmacy student in a community pharmacy : during the last summer, I worked during 2 months and a half in a community pharmacy in Paris. The pharmacy was close to the sea which allowed me to enjoy the beach and the summer weather during my breaks and my days off.
During my job, I learned how operate a pharmacy : the storage, the orders, how to deliver a drug and the advices to patients.. In my opinion, it is useful to know how a pharmacy works before delivering a drug because you could see the medications and their boxs (you should reconize a medication with their esthetic box).
The first 2 weeks of my work was to see and learn "behind" the office : to order medications with a specific quantity (and not to order each drug in a same quantity because you don't sale in a same quantity different medication).
After 2 weeks of work, I started to work "in front of" the pharmacy, with pharmacists and technicians who teach me how to delivering a medication and give advices to patients. It was very intestering and useful as an experience for my study because it helps me for some lectures when it speaks about drugs, molecules.
 In my opinion, I think that my experience as a pharmacy student in a community pharmacy was a very useful discovery of the job, even if I do not want to work in a community pharmacy. It is nice to work during the summer of during the year (half-part job) to have the bases as a futur pharmacist.
